France at the 2000 Summer Olympics Index: Florian Rousseau, Laurent Gané, and Arnaud Tournant won a gold medal in cycling for the men's team sprint event on September 17.
Jérôme Thomas won a bronze medal in boxing for the flyweight category on October 1.
Frédéric Demontfaucon won a bronze medal in judo for the men's 90 kg category on September 20.
Benjamin Varonian won a silver medal in gymnastics for the men's horizontal bar event on September 25.
Éric Poujade won a silver medal in gymnastics for the men's pommel horse event on September 24.
Jeannie Longo won a bronze medal in cycling for the women's road time trial event on September 30.
Anne-Lise Bardet won a bronze medal in canoeing for the women's slalom K-1 event on September 18.
Patrick Chila and Jean-Philippe Gatien won a bronze medal in table tennis for the men's doubles event on September 23.
Delphine Racinet won a silver medal in shooting for the women's trap event on September 18.
Laura Flessel-Colovic won a bronze medal in fencing for the women's épée event on September 17.
Virginie Dedieu and Myriam Lignot won a bronze medal in synchronized swimming for the women's duet event on September 26.
Florian Rousseau won a gold medal in cycling for the men's keirin event on September 21.
Hugues Obry won a silver medal in fencing for the men's épée event on September 16.
Mathieu Gourdain won a silver medal in fencing for the men's sabre event on September 21.
Céline Lebrun won a silver medal in judo for the women's 78 kg category on September 21.
